events.originalText: Unidentified gunmen began a three-day attack on the upmarket Westgate shopping mall in Nairobi, Kenya, resulting in the deaths of 67 people with at least another 175 wounded.
events.subtitle: Westgate shopping mall attack
events.headline: Gunmen attack Westgate shopping mall in Nairobi, Kenya, killing 67

events.originalText: Several British Muslim youths in Peterborough, England, murdered 17-year-old Ross Parker, leading to debate over whether the British media failed to cover racially-motivated crimes with white victims.
events.subtitle: Peterborough
events.headline: British Muslim youths in Peterborough murder 17-year-old Ross Parker

events.originalText: A 7.7 Mw earthquake struck Jiji, Taiwan, killing 2,415 people, injuring more than 11,000 others and causing about NT$300 billion (US$10 billion) in damage across the island.
events.subtitle: Moment magnitude scale
events.headline: 7.7 magnitude earthquake hits Jiji, Taiwan, killing 2,415

events.originalText: The Defense of Marriage Act was passed by the United States Congress, prohibiting federal recognition of same-sex marriage, while allowing states to adopt any marital definition of their choosing.
events.subtitle: Defense of Marriage Act
events.headline: US Congress passes Defense of Marriage Act

events.originalText: The Soviet Union's Zond 5 landed in the Indian Ocean, becoming the first spacecraft to safely return to Earth after travelling around the Moon.
events.subtitle: Zond 5
events.headline: Soviet spacecraft Zond 5 lands in Indian Ocean after trip around Moon

events.originalText: Portugal accepted a diplomatic mission from Southern Rhodesia despite objections by Britain, which had required the colony to implement black majority rule as a condition of independence.
events.subtitle: Rhodesian mission in Lisbon
events.headline: Portugal accepts diplomatic mission from Southern Rhodesia

events.originalText: The first section of Interstate 80 in Iowa (pictured) opened in the Des Moines metropolitan area.
events.subtitle: Interstate 80 in Iowa
events.headline: Interstate 80 section opens in Des Moines metropolitan area

events.originalText: Second World War: The German Army began the Massacre of the Acqui Division on the Greek island of Cephalonia, executing 5,155 Italian soldiers in the next five days.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Army begins Massacre of Acqui Division on Greek island of Cephalonia

events.originalText: The Great New England Hurricane made landfall on Long Island, New York, killing an estimated 682 people and injuring 1,754 others.
events.subtitle: 1938 New England hurricane
events.headline: Great New England Hurricane makes landfall, killing 682

events.originalText: J. R. R. Tolkien's fantasy children's novel The Hobbit, which later served as a prelude to The Lord of the Rings, was first published.
events.subtitle: J. R. R. Tolkien
events.headline: J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit first published

events.originalText: Chandrashekhar Agashe established the Brihan Maharashtra Sugar Syndicate Ltd., one of the oldest companies in India.
events.subtitle: Chandrashekhar Agashe
events.headline: Brihan Maharashtra Sugar Syndicate Ltd. established by Chandrashekhar Agashe

events.originalText: The Muroto typhoon, the strongest in Japanese history at the time, made landfall on the mainland, killing more than 3,000 and leaving around 200,000 homeless.
events.subtitle: 1934 Muroto typhoon
events.headline: Muroto typhoon hits Japan, killing over 3,000

events.originalText: Salvador Lutteroth ran the first Empresa Mexicana de la Lucha Libre event, now the world's oldest professional wrestling promotion in existence, in Mexico City.
events.subtitle: Salvador Lutteroth
events.headline: First Empresa Mexicana de la Lucha Libre event held in Mexico City

events.originalText: World War I: The Battle of Nazareth ended with the British Empire victorious over the Ottomans.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of Nazareth ends with British Empire victory over Ottomans

events.originalText: In response to a letter written by eight-year-old Virginia O'Hanlon, The New York Sun published an editorial by Francis Pharcellus Church stating, "Yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus".
events.subtitle: The Sun (New York City)
events.headline: The New York Sun publishes editorial affirming existence of Santa Claus

events.originalText: According to Joseph Smith, he was first visited by the Angel Moroni, who would guide him to the golden plates that became the basis of the Book of Mormon.
events.subtitle: Joseph Smith
events.headline: Joseph Smith visited by Angel Moroni, finds golden plates for Book of Mormon

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: The Great Fire of New York (depicted) broke out during the British occupation of New York City, destroying up to 1,000 buildings.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Great Fire of New York breaks out during British occupation

events.originalText: Jacobite risings: Jacobite troops led by Charles Edward Stuart (pictured) defeated Hanoverian forces in Prestonpans, Scotland.
events.subtitle: Jacobitism
events.headline: Jacobite troops defeat Hanoverian forces in Prestonpans, Scotland

events.originalText: Led by Antonio de Vea, a Spanish naval expedition departed El Callao, Peru, for the fjords and channels of Patagonia to find whether rival colonial powers were in the region.
events.subtitle: Antonio de Vea
events.headline: Spanish naval expedition departs El Callao for Patagonia exploration

events.originalText: Norman invasion of Ireland: English and Irish forces conquered Dublin, forcing Ascall mac Ragnaill, the last Norse–Gaelic king of Dublin, into exile.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Norman invasion of Ireland
events.headline: Norman invasion forces conquer Dublin, forcing Norse-Gaelic king into exile
